intro: Blephariglottis psycodes var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered blephariglottis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The varietal name "grandiflora" refers to its large, prominent flowers.
